instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.WS_KBD_ONOFF_L: What is WS_KBD_ONOFF_L? WS_KBD_ONOFF_L is a signal that comes from the keyboard that tells the SMC that the power button has been pressed.  L means whatever before the L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v. This signal directly affects SMC_ONOFF_L.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime from the prachtige bin, because i had some time...
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

green light OK
fan spin OK
1 beep when no ram pluged in
usb mouse lights up

but no chime

history i think liquid damage but the board has been at a differnt place before it got trown in my prachtige pile.... they where not even able to get a green light up...

<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 1.046 volts

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>    3.314v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime from the prachtige bin, because i had some time...
threads.message: Do a PRAM reset and connect an LCD and see if you have an image. Speaker in the case (4 pin) must be connected to hear a chime.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime from the prachtige bin, because i had some time...
threads.message:
hi Duke,

tried doing the pram reset, doenst seem to do anything.
check the keyboard on other working logic board and it works.
also have <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_TPAD</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H_TPAD</SIGNAL> on connector and i measure and press the powerbutton <SIGNAL>WS_KBD_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> goes low
speaker also tested and working on other logic board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime from the prachtige bin, because i had some time...
threads.message: If the mouse lights up the board must be alive. Check for image with no BKL on screen.
